body_html:
Why aren't you using the Interpreter class that handled using NativeInterprererWrapper for you?
My guess is that you are not holding onto a reference to the mappedByteBuffer and when it goes out of scope and gets garbage collected, your program crashes since the pointer gets freed.
body_text:
Why aren't you using the Interpreter class that handled using NativeInterprererWrapper for you?
My guess is that you are not holding onto a reference to the mappedByteBuffer and when it goes out of scope and gets garbage collected, your program crashes since the pointer gets freed.
body:
Why aren't you using the Interpreter class that handled using NativeInterprererWrapper for you? 
My guess is that you are not holding onto a reference to the mappedByteBuffer and when it goes out of scope and gets garbage collected, your program crashes since the pointer gets freed.
